en.purpose: To define the severity of sepsis and septic shock.
en.use:
Use in patients >=18 years old. 
Variables: 
-SIRS Criteria (≥ 2 meets SIRS definition):
Temp >38°C (100.4°F) or < 36°C (96.8°F) Yes=1, No=0
Heart rate > 90 Yes=1, No=0
Respiratory rate > 20 or PaCO₂ < 32 mm Hg Yes=1, No=0
WBC > 12,000/mm³, < 4,000/mm³, or > 10% bands Yes=1, No=0

- Sepsis Criteria (SIRS + Source of Infection):
Suspected or present source of infection Yes=1, No=0

- Severe Sepsis Criteria (Organ Dysfunction, Hypotension, or Hypoperfusion)
Lactic acidosis, SBP <90 or SBP drop ≥ 40 mm Hg of normal Yes=1, No=0

- Septic Shock Criteria
Severe sepsis with hypotension, despite adequate fluid resuscitation Yes=1, No=0

- Multiple Organ Dysfunction Syndrome Criteria
Evidence of ≥ 2 organs failing Yes=1, No=0

- Is this a COVID-19 patient? (For research purposes only; answer does NOT impact results.): Confirmed positive, Suspected, Unlikely, Confirmed negative

Formula: Series of Yes/No questions
 
Interpretation: 
SIRS - 2 YES answers meets criteria
Sepsis Criteria - 2 YES of SIRS + Suspected Source of Infection
Severe Sepsis Criteria - 2 YES of SIRS + Lactic Acidosis, SBP
Multiple Organ Dysfunction Syndrome - 2 YES of SIRS + Evidence of ≥ 2 Organs Failing
en.misuse: Not to be used for patients under 18 years old.  Use the Pediatric SIRS, Sepsis, and Septic Shock Criteria for patients under 18.
